Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic legal document on recto (remains of 8 ll.) and verso (list of 16 witnesses). Dated Phaophi of year 24 of Ptolemy III Euergetes I. Cession of land at Armant (Hermonthis) to the Greek Melas son of Apollonios. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "(Archetas is named as priest of Alexander, & Gwtrste (Kottariste?) as Canephoros. The former is the priest of year 24, while the Canephoros belongs apparently to year 23 normally). Cf. the same combination in no. 10407".
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1990a / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum IV: Ptolemaic Legal Texts from the Theban Area (p.83-5, pl.69-70)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (2736) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/2736)
